result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian W Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: With credit for 4 days time served, straight time.
*Probation Review Hearing on 4/22/2016 at 1:30 pm in branch 24.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
*Provide DNA Sample.
*Restitution set at ZERO.

*No contact with firearms.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

*No contact with victim Michelle F. unless approved by the agent.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

*Batterers Intervention program.
*Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

*AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian W Williams

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500 sig bond) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per request of agent, due to defendant absconding and not requesting condition time, probation review cancelled.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 4 days time served, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Michelle F. unless approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.


*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Probation Review Hearing on 4/22/2016 at 1:30 pm in branch 24.

Defendant Brian W Williams in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Brian W Williams in custody.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Attorney Gregory Allan Renden in court, defendant Brian W Williams not in court, in custody.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Defense requests Plea and Sentencing date. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 2/10/2016 at 8:30. Case adjourned to branch 24 for Plea and Sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Brian W Williams in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
12/31/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brian W Williams in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Brian W Williams in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  (Discharge Summary)  rmm
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear for pre-trial conference, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by  portable breathalyzers.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Michelle F;  Sandra K;  SC( juvenile) or their address.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brian W Williams in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian W Williams in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
